Room.Name: The Yawning Portal
Room.Description: The lobby is plainly furnished and is warm and inviting. The walls bear marks as though they have been struck by thrown objects but you see no evidence of exactly what might have been thrown. Beyond the lobby and to the north you see a large inviting room. Behind the counter to the east is a door leading presumably to the back room. The air smells clean, almost sterile.

Room.Name: Common Room
Room.Description: You are in a large, warm room that has been modestly appointed. The floor is wooden and has been polished meticulously and apparently quite frequently as there are no scuffs or other signs of wear. In the back of the room opposite the entrance is a stairway leading up. The stairs appear to have been treated to the same level of attention as the floor. The pleasant sounds and smells of the crackling fireplace fill this room.

Room.Name: Hallway
Room.Description: You are in a hallway that continues on to the north. There are two doors here. The one to the west has a one next to it and the other, to the east, has a five. There are stairs leading down into the common room. This hallway has a wooden floor that appears to be new or is treated to a phenomenal level of care. The air smells like it has somehow been scrubbed clean of all dirt or uncleanliness.

Room.Name: End of Hall
Room.Description: You are at the end of the hallway. There is a door to the west with a two next to it, one to the north with a three and one to the east with a four. The floor here has also been treated with amazing care and the air has the same clean, sterile smell.

Room.Name: Room # 1
Room.Description: The room is small but comfortable. The air smells of a woman's perfume. There are no windows or exits other than the door.

Room.Name: Room # 5
Room.Description: You are in a small, cramped room. There is no window or exit other than the door you just came through. It smells like pine in here.

Room.Name: Room # 2
Room.Description: The room is average size as far as bedrooms go. The air smells fresh and clean in here.

Room.Name: Room # 3
Room.Description: You are in a very large, comfortable room. There are tapestries depicting beautiful dancing girls and various other festive scenes.

Room.Name: Room # 4
Room.Description: You are in an average bedroom. The walls are bare except for a strange stain near the door. There is no window or other exit other than the way you came in. The room has a slight chill to it and smells like ale.

ExtraDescription.Description: You can't tell what it might have caused it. It could be blood or it could be chocolate or some other food or drink.

Room.Name: Back Room
Room.Description: You are in the backroom behind the counter. There are various housekeeping supplies stored here. The floor creaks loudly as you walk across it and the room is very dry and clean. There is nothing of any interest here other than the door back out to the lobby, a door in the south wall and a staircase leading down.

Room.Name: Innkeeper's Quarters
Room.Description: You are in the innkeeper's room which is sparsely furnitured. The faint smell of wood lingers here with a tint of apothecary salve. The place has been meticulously cleaned and not so much as a hair can be seen. There is a door in the north wall that leads to the back room.

Room.Name: Basement
Room.Description: You are in a the basement of the Yawning Portal. There are various tightly sealed and weighted down casks and barrels. There are shelves with strange carved figurines of mutated, twisted people and animals which you feel no desire to take. Whoever carved these is truly sick. The air is slightly musty and the room is a little damp. The air is cool down here. There are stairs leading up from here.

Room.Name: The Red-Eyed Owl
Room.Description: You are in the entrance to the Red-Eyed Owl. There is a painting of a beautiful dark-haired woman, someone you presume is important to this establishment, firmly attached to the wall here. From inside the tavern you can hear singing and the occasional n ame calling match. The tavern is warm and inviting and there is a pleasant odor of roast something wafting your way. To the south of you is the exit to Dungeon Drive.

Room.Name: Common Room
Room.Description: This room is quite large and very homey. The decor is sparse but functional. To the north and east are unmarked doors. The door to the east is behind the bar that takes up most of the eastern wall. You don't see anywhere to get food but you can smell it.

Room.Name: Private Room
Room.Description: This room is for private use by the customers who can afford it. It can be used for different purposes but it is usually for private parties. The only exit is the door to the south.

Room.Name: The Back Room
Room.Description: You are in the back room of the tavern. The air here smells of delicious roast meat with a tint of beer. The only exits are the door leading back out to the Common Room, a door in the north wall and a staircase leading down.

Room.Name: Living Quarters
Room.Description: You are in the owner's living quarters. The place is very messy. The bed is unmade and it looks like some 'entertaining' has occurred recently. It smells like old food and alcohol in here.

Room.Name: Wine Cellar
Room.Description: You are in a damp wine cellar. There are cobwebs stretching in the south corner of the room. The air is musty here. There is a staircase leading up and a door to the north.

Room.Name: Storage Room
Room.Description: The room is very musty and damp from having been flooded in the near past.

Room.Name: The Sleepy Sylph
Room.Description: The Sleepy Sylph Tavern. Door to North leads to North Street. South is Common Room.

Room.Name: Halls of Hilmer
Room.Description: This is the inside of the armourer Hilmer's establishment. All around are the fruits of his labor. The shop is not decorated other than by the wares he has on display. The air smells of hot coal and metal and is very warm, almost uncomfortably so. There is a door in the west wall that leads outside to Dirk Lane and doors in the north and south walls that most likely go to private parts of the shop. To the east is an open area where Hilmer works.

Room.Name: Corner of North Street and Mandrake Avenue
Room.Description: You are at the northern end of Mandrake where it intersects with the beginning of North Street to the east. To the south Mandrake Avenue stretches out before you totally congested with traffic and bordered its entire length by building after closely packed building. The cobbled stones of the roads have been worn smooth by the volume of traffic. Carts and horses and people on foot are constantly going here and there regardless of the time of day. The air is cool and moist and smells like a stuffy linen closet.

Room.Name: North Street 100 Block
Room.Description: North Street 100 Block. East to Intersection of North Street and Dirk Lane. West to Corner of North Street and Mandrake Avenue. South to Bath House.

Room.Name: Intersection of North Street and Dirk Lane
Room.Description: Intersection of North Street and Dirk Lane. East to North Street 300 Block. South to Dirk Lane 100 Block. West to North Street 100 Block.

Room.Name: North Street 300 Block
Room.Description: This is the 300 block of North Street. To the east North Street continues on and to the west it appears to intersect with another street. The road appears to be quite worn here.

Room.Name: Northern Gate
Room.Description: You are standing on the 400 block of North Street. In front of you is a large gate leading into and out of the city. People and travellers move in and out going to distant places. To the north is the Great Northern Trail which is flanked by the Durgas River and the DearthWood. The 500 block of North Street is to the east and the 300 Block is to the west.

Room.Name: North Street 500 Block
Room.Description: North Street 500 Block. East to North Street 600 Block. West to North Street 400 Block.

Room.Name: North Street 600 Block
Room.Description: North Street 600 Block. East to North Street 700 Block. West to North Street 500 Block. Door South to The Sleepy Sylph.

Room.Name: North Street 700 Block
Room.Description: North Street 700 Block. East to Intersection of North Street and Blue Drake Road. West to North Street 600 Block.

Room.Name: Intersection of North Street and Blue Drake Road
Room.Description: Intersection of North Street and Blue Drake Road. East to Corner of North Street and Grehyton Road. South to Blue Drake Road 100 Block.

Room.Name: Corner of North Street and Grehyton Road
Room.Description: Corner of North Street and Grehyton Road. South to Grehyton Road 100 Block. West to Intersection of North Street and Blue Drake Road.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 100 Block
Room.Description: You are on a more placid section of Mandrake Avenue. There are about half as many people on the street here. Mandrake continues on to the north from here and intersects with another street to the south. To the east is a break in the tightly packed buildings, a clearing in the urban forest, the Bath House. You can hear the occasional laugh coming from inside. From time to time someone will go in dirty or come out clean and refreshed. To the west is a small alley cutting its way through the jam packed buildings lining that side of the street.

Room.Name: Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and Storm Crest Avenue
Room.Description: Two large well travelled streets meet here. Mandrake continues on to the north and south from here and Storm Crest begins to the east. There is a convergence of traffic here that occurs regardless of the time of day. This city never seems to sleep. The air smells as varied as the people who walk through it. Your senses are further assaulted by the echo that occurs because of the street encasing buildings that continue without relief.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 300 Block
Room.Description: All around you are buildings crammed together in haphazard fashion. The well worn road continues north and south with intersections in both directions. This section of road is in a minor state of disrepair compared to the rest of Mandrake Avenue. There are several cobble stones missing from the otherwise flawless surface. You can see signs that repairs are underway but no one is currently doing them. The air smells of stone and damp earth and has a slight chill to it.

Room.Name: Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and Dirk Lane
Room.Description: You are at an intersection of three roads. The larger Mandrake Avenue continues on to the north and south and the smaller Dirk Lane begins to the east while Eib Road leads off into the New District to the west. Many people are standing about on the corners and some are a bit shady looking. You see guards move through the crowds looking for trouble.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 500 Block
Room.Description: You are surrounded by various unmarked buildings. The smooth cobbled stones of the street have been worn smooth by constant traffic which never seems to ebb. The air is cool here but the many tightly packed buildings keep it virtually still. To the north Mandrake Avenue intersects with another street and to the south Mandrake continues on as far as you can see.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 600 Block
Room.Description: Mandrake Avenue continues from here to the north and to the south where it intersects with another main road. The cobbled stones here are very smooth and in excellent condition. The air smells damp with earthen undertones. The street is crowded all times of the day and the sounds echoing off the tightly packed buildings only serve to magnify this effect.

Room.Name: Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and Dungeon Drive
Room.Description: Here is where Mandrake Avenue intersects with Dungeon Drive. The streets are fairly well tended here with almost no stones missing. The air smells like horses and too many people. Mandrake Avenue continues both north and south of here. To the east is the beginning of Dungeon Drive. There are many guards travelling to and from this road as well as many citizens coming here to get water for their homes.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 800 Block
Room.Description: This is a well travelled intersection of Mandrake Avenue. A large reinforced looking building lies to the east with the sign of Calinth Bank on its door. To the west is a small alleyway creeping its way into the new district. Guards and people move through this intersection constantly. Several merchants come and go from the bank, increasing their wealth with each visit. To the west is a small alley.

Room.Name: Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and Riverfront Way
Room.Description: You are at the intersection of two large, well-travelled roads. To the north runs Mandrake Avenue and to the south is where Mandrake crosses the Durgas river. East is the beginning of Riverfront Way which follows the east-west course of the Durgas. The cobbled stones here are somewhat damp and the smell of the river is quite disturbingly foul. This whole street has been packed with buildings and this area is no exception. In some areas partially demolished buildings have had new constructions started before the demolition was finished.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue on the Durgas River Bridge
Room.Description: You are on a solidly constructed stone bridge with a wooden covering. The smell of the river is very potent here and is almost intolerable. The stone of the bridge is smooth and damp and the air is moist and dripping with the stench of waste products, a smell you can unfortunately almost taste.

Room.Name: Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and South Bank Drive
Room.Description: This is the intersection of two large, busy streets. Mandrake Avenue crosses the Durgas river to the north and continues on to the the south. South Bank Drive begins to the east and you can see another intersection in that direction. The air here is quite foul from the use of the river as a sewage system. The street is tightly packed with buildings, many of which are growing fungi and spores of various types. The road is moist and the well worn stones are somewhat slick.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 1100 Block
Room.Description: You are on Mandrake Avenue. The air here has a faint scent of something foul. All around you are buildings pushed tightly together. It is difficult to tell where one building ends and the next begins. To the north you can see an intersection with another street and to the south Mandrake Avenue continues.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 1200 Block
Room.Description: The smooth stones of Mandrake Avenue lay at your feet. The street is overcrowded with nameless establishments, apartments and closed doors. The dizzying array of building fronts and loud echoing creates an air of tension here. The air smells faintly of the sea. Mandrake Avenue continues on both to the north and south of here.

Room.Name: Mandrake Avenue 1300 Block
Room.Description: You can see the end of Mandrake Avenue to the south where it meets up with another main road. The street here is less crowded with people but still flanked on both sides by an unbroken stretch of building fronts. To the north Mandrake Avenue stretches as far as you can see. The hard cobbled stones at your feet have been worn smooth by years of service and the road has been kept in excellent condition. There are no stones missing and the street is very clean. The air here smells more strongly of the sea and you can hear sea birds off in the distance.

Room.Name: Corner of Mandrake Avenue and Calinth Way
Room.Description: You are at the end of Mandrake Avenue and the beginning of Calinth Way. Mandrake Avenue stretches off to the north as far as you can see. Calinth Way begins to the east where you can see an intersection with another street. The road here appears to be used quite heavily as the cobbled stones are quite worn. There is traffic here at all times of the day and the many tightly packed buildings help to create a closed in feel to the street. The air smells strongly of the sea. You can hear the water in the distance and the sounds of birds calling out to each other. The occasional bell can be heard as well.

Room.Name: Dirk Lane 100 Block
Room.Description: Dirk Lane 100 Block. North to Intersection of North Street and Dirk Lane. South to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Dirk Lane.

Room.Name: Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Dirk Lane
Room.Description: Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Dirk Lane. North to Dirk Lane 100 Block. East to Storm Crest Avenue 300 Block. South to Dirk Lane 300 Block. West to Storm Crest Avenue 100 Block.

Room.Name: Dirk Lane 300 Block
Room.Description: Dirk Lane 300 Block. North to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Dirk Lane. Door East to Hilmer Warehouse. South to Dirk Lane 400 Block.

Room.Name: Dirk Lane 400 Block
Room.Description: The cobbled road turns here. Dirk Lane continues on to the north and to the west. From the door to the east you can hear the ringing sounds of a hammer striking metal. There is a sign over the door that reads 'Halls of Hilmer'. You can smell a furnace and hot metal in the air. The street is not as crowded here and you are able to move more freely.

Room.Name: Dirk Lane 500 Block
Room.Description: You are in the street surrounded by buildings on both sides. To the north is a door leading into an Inn called The Yawning Portal. To the east Dirk Lane continues and to the west is an intersection with another larger street. The air smells like burning wood, undoubtedly from a fireplace inside the inn.

Room.Name: Storm Crest Avenue 100 Block
Room.Description: Storm Crest Avenue 100 Block. East to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Dirk Lane. West to Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and Storm Crest Avenue.

Room.Name: Storm Crest Avenue 300 Block
Room.Description: Storm Crest Avenue 300 Block. East to Storm Crest Avenue 400 Block. West to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Dirk Lane.

Room.Name: Storm Crest Avenue 400 Block
Room.Description: Storm Crest Avenue 400 Block. East to Storm Crest Avenue 500 Block. South to North Storm Crest Alley. West to Storm Crest Avenue 300 Block.

Room.Name: Storm Crest Avenue 500 Block
Room.Description: Storm Crest Avenue 500 Block. East to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Grayford Lane. Door South to Palauvir's Counter. West to Storm Crest Avenue 400 Block.

Room.Name: Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Grayford Lane
Room.Description: Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Grayford Lane. East to Storm Crest Avenue 700 Block. South to Grayford Lane 100 Block. West to Storm Crest Avenue 500 Block.

Room.Description: Storm Crest Avenue 700 Block. East to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Blue Drake Road. West to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Grayford Lane.

Room.Description: Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Blue Drake Road. North to Blue Drake Road 100 Block. East to Storm Crest Avenue 900 Block. South to Blue Drake Road 300 Block. West to Storm Crest Avenue 700 Block.

Room.Description: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Storm Crest Avenue. North to Grehyton Road 100 Block. South to Grehyton Road 300 Block. West to Storm Crest Avenue 900 Block.

Room.Name: End of Blue Drake Road 500 Block

Room.Name: Grehyton Road 100 Block

Room.Name: Grehyton Road 300 Block
Room.Description: Grehyton Road 300 Block. North to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Storm Crest Avenue. South to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Gables Place.

Room.Name: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Gables Place
Room.Description: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Gables Place. North to Grehyton Road 300 Block. South to Grehyton Road 500 Block. West to Gables Place 100 Block.

Room.Description: Grehyton Road 600 Block. North to Grehyton Road 500 Block. South to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Dungeon Drive.

Room.Name: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Dungeon Drive
Room.Description: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Dungeon Drive. North to Grehyton Road 600 Block. South to Grehyton Road 800 Block. West to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Doorstop Drive.

Room.Name: Grehyton Road 800 Block
Room.Description: Grehyton Road 800 Block. North to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Dungeon Drive. South to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Riverfront Way. Door West to Khostall Hanuss, Fine Nuts.

Room.Name: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Riverfront Way
Room.Description: Intersection of Grehyton Road and Riverfront Way. North to Grehyton Road 800 Block. South to Grehyton Road on Leherak Bridge. West to Intersection of Riverfront Way and Doorstop Drive.

Room.Name: Grehyton Road on Leherak Bridge
Room.Description: Grehyton Road on Leherak Bridge. North to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Riverfront Way. South to Intersection of Grehyton Road and South Bank Drive.

Room.Name: Intersection of Grehyton Road and South Bank Drive
Room.Description: Intersection of Grehyton Road and South Bank Drive. North to Grehyton Road on Leherak Bridge. South to Grehyton Road 1000 Block. West to Intersection of South Bank Drive and Doorstop Drive.

Room.Name: Grehyton Road 1000 Block
Room.Description: Grehyton Road 1000 Block. North to Intersection of Grehyton Road and South Bank Drive. South to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Troll Street.

Room.Name: The East Gate Of Calinth
Room.Description: You are standing at the intersection of Grehyton Road and Troll Street. In front of you is a large gate leading into and out of the city. People and travellers move in and out going to distant places. To the east is the East Road and the DearthWood. The 1000 block of Grehyton Road is to the north and the 1300 Block is to the south. To the west lies the 500 Block of Troll Street.

Room.Name: Grehyton Road 1300 Block
Room.Description: Grehyton Road 1300 Block. North to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Troll Street. South to Corner of Grehyton Road and Calinth Way.

Room.Name: Corner of Grehyton Road and Calinth Way
Room.Description: Corner of Grehyton Road and Calinth Way. North to Grehyton Road 1300 Block. West to Calinth Way 600 Block.

Room.Name: North Storm Crest Alley
Room.Description: North Storm Crest Alley. North to Storm Crest Avenue 400 Block. South to South Storm Crest Alley.

Room.Name: South Storm Crest Alley
Room.Description: South Storm Crest Alley. North to North Storm Crest Alley. South to Colton Circle 300 Block.

Room.Name: Colton Circle 300 Block
Room.Description: Colton Circle 300 Block. North to South Storm Crest Alley. East to Colton Circle 400 Block. West to Colton Circle 200 Block.

Room.Name: Grayford Lane 100 Block
Room.Description: Grayford Lane 100 Block. North to Intersection of Storm Crest Avenue and Grayford Lane. South to Intersection of Grayford Lane and Gables Place.

Room.Name: Intersection of Grayford Lane and Gables Place
Room.Description: Intersection of Grayford Lane and Gables Place. North to Grayford Lane 100 Block. East to Gables Place 300 Block. South to Grayford Lane 300 Block. West to End of Gables Place.

Room.Name: Grayford Lane 300 Block
Room.Description: Grayford Lane 300 Block. North to Intersection of Grayford Lane and Gables Place. South to Grayford Lane 400 Block.

Room.Name: Grayford Lane 400 Block
Room.Description: Grayford Lane 400 Block. North to Grayford Lane 300 Block. Door East to Stormwatch. South to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and End of Grayford Lane.

Room.Name: Intersection of Dungeon Drive and End of Grayford Lane
Room.Description: Intersection of Dungeon Drive and End of Grayford Lane. North to Grayford Lane 400 Block. East to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Doorstop Drive. West to Dungeon Drive 500 Block.

Room.Name: End of Gables Place 500 Block
Room.Description: End of Gables Place 500 Block. Door North to The Pampered Traveler. East to Intersection of Grayford Lane and Gables Place.

Room.Name: Gables Place 300 Block
Room.Description: Gables Place 300 Block. East to Intersection of Blue Drake Road and Gables Place. West to Intersection of Grayford Lane and Gables Place.

Room.Name: Gables Place 100 Block
Room.Description: Gables Place 100 Block. East to Intersection of Greyhton Road and Gables Place. West to Intersection of Blue Drake Road and Gables Place.

Room.Name: Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Colton Circle
Room.Description: You are at the intersection of Dungeon Drive and Colton Circle, to the is the 100 block of Colton Circle, while to the east is the 300 block of Dungeon Drive. To the west you can hear the sounds of laughter and talking coming for a local bar. There is a strange smell in the air here.

Room.Name: Colton Circle 100 Block
Room.Description: Colton Circle 100 Block. North to Colton Circle 200 Block. Door East to Smithy. South to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Colton Circle.

Room.Name: Colton Circle 200 Block
Room.Description: Colton Circle 200 Block. East to Colton Circle 300 Block. Door West to The Captain's Office. South to Colton Circle 100 Block.

Room.Name: Colton Circle 400 Block
Room.Description: Colton Circle 400 Block. Door North to Rahib's Jewels. South to Colton Circle 500 Block. West to Colton Circle 300 Block.

Room.Name: Colton Circle 500 Block
Room.Description: Colton Circle 500 Block. North to Colton Circle 400 Block. South to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and End of Colton Circle.

Room.Name: Intersection of Dungeon Drive and End of Colton Circle
Room.Description: You are at a busy intersection of Dungeon Drive and the end of Colton Circle. North of here Colton Circle continues while to the east is Dungeon Drive. To the west you can see the bell tower and a local guard house.

Room.Name: Dungeon Drive 100 Block
Room.Description: You are standing on the 100 block of Dungeon Drive, to the east is Colton Circle while to the west lies Mandrake Avenue. Laughter and yelling can be heard coming from the north, where a large sign indicates the entrance to The Red-Eyed Owl, A local hangout for off-duty guards.

Room.Name: Dungeon Drive 300 Block
Room.Description: You are standing in a busy section of town. To the north is the entrance to the bell tower, while to the south is the local Guardhouse. East of here is a small intersection of Dungeon Drive and Colton Circle. Every now and then a member of the local Guards enters or leaves the building to the south.

Room.Name: Dungeon Drive 500 Block
Room.Description: A filthy stench permeates the air here. It seems to be coming from a large building to the south that appears to be a jail. East of here is a small intersection while to the west a busier intersection awaits. Various townsfolk move to and from the jail door here, dropping of items for friends or family in the jail. There is a heavy guard presence in this area.

Room.Name: Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Doorstop Drive
Room.Description: Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Doorstop Drive. East to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Dungeon Drive. South to Doorstop Drive 100 Block. West to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and End of Grayford Lane.

Room.Name: Doorstop Drive 100 Block
Room.Description: Doorstop Drive 100 Block. North to Intersection of Dungeon Drive and Doorstop Drive. South to Intersection of Riverfront Way and Doorstop Drive.

Room.Name: Intersection of Riverfront Way and Doorstop Drive
Room.Description: Intersection of Riverfront Way and Doorstop Drive. North to Doorstop Drive 100 Block. East to Intersection of Grehyton Road and Riverfront Way. South to Doorstop Drive on Xavumeer Bridge. West to Riverfront Way 500 Block.

Room.Name: Doorstop Drive on Xavumeer Bridge
Room.Description: Doorstop Drive on Xavumeer Bridge. North to Intersection of Riverfront Way and Doorstop Drive. South to Intersection of South Bank Drive and End of Doorstop Drive.

Room.Name: Intersection of South Bank Drive and End of Doorstop Drive
Room.Description: Intersection of South Bank Drive and End of Doorstop Drive. North to Doorstop Drive on Xavumeer Bridge. East to Intersection of Grehyton Road and South Bank Drive. Door South to The Elfstone. West to South Bank Drive 500 Block.

Room.Name: Riverfront Way 100 Block
Room.Description: Riverfront Way 100 Block. East to Riverfront Way 200 Block. West to Intersection of Mandrake Avenue and Riverfront Way.

Room.Name: Riverfront Way 200 Block
Room.Description: Riverfront Way 200 Block. East to Riverfront Way 300 Block. West to Riverfront Way 100 Block.

Room.Name: Riverfront Way 300 Block
Room.Description: Riverfront Way 300 Block. East to Riverfront Way 400 Block. West to Riverfront Way 200 Block.

Room.Name: Riverfront Way 400 Block
Room.Description: Riverfront Way 400 Block. East to Riverfront Way 500 Block. West to Riverfront Way 300 Block.

Room.Name: Riverfront Way 500 Block
Room.Description: Riverfront Way 500 Block. Door North to Heroes' Rest. East to Intersection of Riverfront Way and Doorstop Drive. West to Riverfront Way 400 Block.

Room.Name: Intersection of South Bank Drive and Hedram Place
Room.Description: This segment of the slick South Bank Drive is highlighted by a juncture with Hedram Place to the south. To the west is the beginning of South Bank Drive and to the east the drive continues as far as the crowded street will allow you to see. The stench here is quite difficult to bear as evidenced by the occasional passerby losing his lunch near the river bank. To the north one could enter the Durgas river and become more closely familiar with its stench and the source of this foulness. The cobbled stones here are damp and have growth on them, despite this treacherous road condition the people who travel this road move quite quickly and many appear to be holding their breath.

Room.Name: South Bank Drive 200 Block
Room.Description: South Bank Drive 200 Block. East to South Bank Drive 300 Block. West to Intersection of South Bank Drive and Hedram Place.

Room.Name: South Bank Drive 300 Block
Room.Description: South Bank Drive 300 Block. East to Intersection of South Bank Drive and Forworth Boulevard. Door South to the Slaughterhouse. West to South Bank Drive 200 Block.

Room.Name: Intersection of South Bank Drive and Forworth Boulevard
Room.Description: Intersection of South Bank Drive and Forworth Boulevard. East to South Bank Drive 500 Block. West to South Bank Drive 300 Block. South to Forworth Boulevard 100 Block.

Room.Name: South Bank Drive 500 Block
Room.Description: South Bank Drive 500 Block. East to Intersection of South Bank Drive and Doorstop Drive. West to Intersection of South Bank Drive and Forworth Boulevard.

Room.Name: Hedram Place 100 Block
Room.Description: You are at the beginning of Hedram Place, an oft-used roadway for merchants and carriers heading towards the docks. The cobbled stones here are in varying states of disrepair as if no city stonemasons have been through here in quite some time. This unusual feature is compounded by the fact that the buildings here actually have small spaces between them. The echo effect is lessened and you can actually hear the sound of the foul Durgas river to the north, the smell of course is always present and eternally sickening. Hedram place ends to the north where it intersects with a larger road. To the south the road intersects another side road and continues on towards the bay. There is a door to the west with a sign labeled The Wandering Wemic overhead.

Room.Name: Intersection of Troll Street and Hedram Place
Room.Description: This juction is less crowded and the traffic is smoother somehow. Most of the buildings in this area show no signs of any recent or current activity. Still, there are many people on the cobbled road going about their business or just wandering the streets. Hedram Place continues north and south from here and Troll Street begins to the east. You catch the faint whiff of something very foul.

Room.Name: Hedram Place 300 Block
Room.Description: You are on a relatively nondescript section of Hedram Place. Nameless buildings surround you on both sides, their closed doors keeping their secrets inside. The street is busy with activity all times of the day and the smell of sea air compliments the musky odor of horses and other beasts of burden carrying their master's wares. To the north and the south Hedram Place intersects with other roads.

Room.Name: Intersection of Calinth Way and Hedram Place
Room.Description: You are at an intersection of two streets. The crowded streets give no headway here as convoluted traffic surges through this junction. The smell of sea salt fills the air and you can feel the occasional breeze as it squeezes its way through the tightly packed buildings or crashes over their roofs like a wave. To the north lies Hedram Place a narrow less-trafficked throughway. To the west Calinth Way comes to an end and joins up with another street. To the east Calinth Way continues onward filled with travelers.

Room.Name: Forworth Boulevard 100 Block
Room.Description: Forworth Boulevard 100 Block. North to Intersection of South Bank Drive and Forworth Boulevard.

Room.Name: Intersection of Troll Street and Forworth Boulevard
Room.Description: Intersection of Troll Street and Forworth Boulevard. North to Forworth Boulevard 100 Block. East to Troll Street 400 Block. South to Forworth Boulevard 300 Block. West to Troll Street 200 Block.

Room.Name: Forworth Boulevard 300 Block
Room.Description: Forworth Boulevard 300 Block. North to Intersection of Troll Street and Forworth Boulevard. South to Intersection of Calinth Way and Forworth Boulevard.

Room.Name: Intersection of Calinth Way and Forworth Boulevard
Room.Description: Intersection of Calinth Way and Forworth Boulevard. North to Forworth Boulevard 300 Block. East to Calinth Way 500 Block. West to Calinth Way 300 Block.

Room.Name: Troll Street 100 Block
Room.Description: Troll Street 100 Block. East to Troll Street 200 Block. Door South to Riautar's Weaponry. West to Intersection of Troll Street and Hedram Place.

Room.Description: Troll Street 500 Block. East to Intersection of Greyhton Road and Troll Street. Door South to The Blue Jack. West to Troll Street 400 Block.

Room.Name: Calinth Way 200 Block
Room.Description: Calinth Way 200 Block. East to Calinth Way 300 Block. West to Intersection of Calinth Way and Hedram Place.

Room.Name: Calinth Way 300 Block
Room.Description: Calinth Way 300 Block. East to Intersection of Calinth Way and Forworth Boulevard. West to Calinth Way 200 Block.

Room.Name: Calinth Way 500 Block
Room.Description: Calinth Way 500 Block. Door North to Melgard's Fine Leather. East to Calinth Way 600 Block. West to Intersection of Calinth Way and Forworth Boulevard.

Room.Name: Office
Room.Description: Office. Door North to Common Room.

Room.Name: Warriors of Calinth Monument Plaza
Room.Description: Warriors of Calinth Monument Plaza. East to Grehyton Road 100 Block. West to Blue Drake Road 100 Block.

Room.Name: Melgard's Fine Leather
Room.Description: Melgard's Fine Leather. North to Leather Making Area. Door East to Common Room. Door South to Calinth Way 500 Block.

Room.Name: Leather Making Area
Room.Description: Leather Making Area. South to Melgard's Fine Leather. Door West to Storage.

Room.Name: Storage
Room.Description: Storage. Door East to Leather Making Area.

Room.Name: Common Room
Room.Description: Common Room. Door North Bedroom. East to Kitchen and Dining Area. Door West to Melgard's Fine Leather.

Room.Name: Bedroom
Room.Description: Bedroom. Door South to Common Room.

Room.Name: Kitchen and Dining Area
Room.Description: Kitchen and Dining Area. West to Common Room.

Room.Name: Bath House Atrium
Room.Description: You are in a relatively peaceful atrium. The doric marble columns and tiled floor give this area a soothing feel There are open doorways to the roads of Calinth to the north and west. To the south is an inviting garden and to the east is a changing room. Various patrons are moving through this area at all times of the day both coming and going. The air smells both clean and dirty, a perfect model of the city itself.

Room.Name: Fountain Garden
Room.Description: The garden is well attended and has been cared for quite lovingly by its keeper. It is the perfect blend of plants pleasing to all the senses. The scent of fresh blossoming flowers and freshly turned soil combine to put one's sole at ease. These surroundings are in perfect harmony with one another. This spot is a favorite site for lovers and families alike. The garden is surrounded by high walls to keep out the sounds of the surrounding city and the only exit is to the north leading into the atrium.

Room.Name: Changing Room
Room.Description: In this room are carefully organized piles of clothing and personal belongings. Several attendants wander through here assuring that all is well. Numerous patrons are both stripping and dressing here. To the east you can see the main pool and to the west is the atrium and the exits.

Room.Name: Main Pool Side
Room.Description: The main pool is here and is filled with bathers. Many naked visitors are lounging about here. There are steps leading down into the main pool where most people are enjoying themselves. North of here you can see a smaller pool, to the east is a door and going west leads to the changing room.

Room.Name: Small, Heated, Bubbling Pool
Room.Description: This room holds one of the treasures of civilization. The steaming pool is most inviting and is frequented by couples engaging their passions almost any hour of the day. The pool, while smaller than the main pool, is still large enough for several people. The air smells a bit smokey in here but it only adds to the flavor of the moment.

Room.Name: Steam Room
Room.Description: Steam Room. Door West to Main Pool. This room is filled with thick steam and you instantly begin to perspire upon entering. The hot air causes you to gasp at first but soon relaxes you. As with the small, heated, bubbling pool this room is a treasure and is frequented by passionate couples and elderly citizens. Within moments patrons feel revived and desire to have a dunk in the main pool. The only exit is a door to the west.

Room.Name: First Bank of Calinth
Room.Description: You are in the lobby of the First Bank of Calinth. The walls appear to be marble and the interior is very well appointed. To the east is the clerk's window where most transactions occur. To the south lies the area here the loan agent denies applicants. To the west is the exit to Mandrake Avenue.

Room.Name: Loan Agent
Room.Description: This is the area where the loan agent 'works'. The air here is filled with tension and the smell of sweat. The floor here appears quite worn. To the south is a door labeled Manager's office. The lobby lies to the north.

Room.Name: Clerk's Window
Room.Description: You are standing at the clerks window of the First Bank Of Calinth. To the east behind the counter is a large vault door that is often closed and obviously locked. West of here is the main entrance to the bank where various clerks and patrons move about. The smell of money permeates this area.

Room.Name: Manager's Office
Room.Description: This is the Manager's office. This room is lavishly decorated and appears to have no real function other than to cater to the manager's whims. There is nothing in this office to indicate that any real work is performed here. The air here has a sweet smell, like rose petals. To the north is the door that leads back to the loan agent's area.

Room.Name: Vault
Room.Description: You are inside of the vault. The walls here are bare in accord with its spartan function. It smells like money in here. This area is not very large and has a very secure feel to it. To the west is the Clerk's window.

Room.Name: Palauvir's Counter
Room.Description: Palauvir's Counter. Door North to Storm Crest Avenue 500 Block. Door South to Backroom.

Room.Name: Back Room
Room.Description: Back Room. Door North to Palauvir's Counter. Door East to Storage. Door West to Quarters.

Room.Name: The Captain's Office
Room.Description: The Captain's Office. Door East to Colton Circle 200 Block.

Room.Name: Jail House
Room.Description: This is a large stone courtyard for the Jail. Guards are up on the walls and some are marching back and forth up and down the square. To the east you see a small office door with a warder symbol on it. To the west is a large door that leads to the common cell room. South of here you can here screams of agony and pain coming from behind a wooden door.

Room.Name: Office
Room.Description: Office. Door West to Jail House.

Room.Name: Interrogation Area
Room.Description: Interrogation Area. Door North to Jail House. Door East to Cell #1. Door South to Cell #2. Door West to Cell #3.

Room.Name: Large Common Cell
Room.Description: Large Common Cell. Door East to Jail House.

Room.Name: Cell #1
Room.Description: Cell. Door East to Interrogation Area.

Room.Name: Cell #2
Room.Description: Cell. Door North to Interrogation Area.

Room.Name: Cell #3
Room.Description: Cell. Door West to Interrogation Area.

Room.Name: Tuck's Store
Room.Description: Tuck's Store. Door East to Doorstop Drive 100 Block. Door West to Back Room.

Room.Name: Back Room
Room.Description: Back Room. Door North to Quarters. Door East to Tuck's Store. Door West to Storage.

Room.Name: Storage
Room.Description: Storage. Door East to Back Room.

Room.Name: Quarters
Room.Description: Quarters. Door South to Back Room.

Room.Name: MOB Storage Room
Room.Description: This room is for the storage of MOBs until they are required. This allows you to do a mob transfer and avoid having to mob load. This room is only for immortals and purposely has no exits. Feel free to store objects in here as well.

Room.Name: In the Main Pool
Room.Description: You are in the main pool. All around you people are cleaning or playing in the pool. Children and there families are in abundance. No one has anything to hide here. There are many attractive members of the opposite sex here both alone and with friends but the cold water tends to ward off any feelings of romance. There are steps leading up out of the pool.

NPC.name: fellow cockeyed odd
NPC.description: Zod looks like he is somewhere else right now.
NPC.longDescription: The fellow looks at you with a strange, discomforting stare.

NPC.name: warrior scowling berak
NPC.description: He gives you a 'go to hell' look then looks away.
NPC.longDescription: A warrior is here with a permanent scowl on his face.

NPC.name: guard duty off off-duty
NPC.description: The guard looks intoxicated and stares back at you. Hopefully he won't make any trouble as he is fully armed and armored and looks pretty tough.
NPC.longDescription: An off-duty guard is here sampling ales.
NPC.flags: NPC StayArea Warrior NoPurge AssistGuard AssistVnum

NPC.name: butcher blood-stained
NPC.description: An angry man, he spends his time trying to silence the lambs.
NPC.longDescription: The butcher grunts and offers you a haggis..
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior NoPurge Shopkeeper

NPC.name: merchant smiling fat
NPC.description: A plump and strong looking man who has been moving merchandise his whole life.
NPC.longDescription: The merchant stands here waiting to help you.

NPC.name: weaponsmith muscular young
NPC.description: A young muscular man who smiles as he works.
NPC.longDescription: A skilled, muscular, young weaponsmith greets you.

NPC.name: armourer muscle-bound old
NPC.description: An old but very muscular man. He has probably made more armours in his lifetime than you have ever seen.
NPC.longDescription: An old, muscle bound armourer stands here.

NPC.name: sly thief
NPC.description: Well, COUNT your money!
NPC.longDescription: A sly looking man is here.

NPC.name: citizen female
NPC.description: She is a typical citizen going about her business.
NPC.longDescription: A female citizen is walking the street here.

NPC.name: man noble
NPC.description: He is dressed just like you would expect a noble to be and has an air of "better than you" about him. He is cleaner than you and smells better, too.
NPC.longDescription: A noble man is here apparently out slumming.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Gain NoPurge AssistVnum

NPC.name: boy haired brown
NPC.description: He is young and has close-cropped hair and looks quite happy.
NPC.longDescription: A brown haired boy is here, humming gently.

NPC.name: man hawk eyed fat
NPC.description: He is fat and has a content although watchful look on his face.
NPC.longDescription: Rahib stands here, coughing and hacking

NPC.name: worker leather woman
NPC.description: She looks like an honest, hard-working artisan who only just earns enough to keep herself going.
NPC.longDescription: The leather worker is sitting by a table, sewing a leather cap.

NPC.name: guy average
NPC.description: This man seems a bit out of place, roaming around and mumbling to himself quite frequently.
NPC.longDescription: A guy who wont shut up, stands here.

NPC.name: farmer
NPC.description: When he notices you looking at him he asks if you know where the marketplace is, but looks away before you can answer.
NPC.longDescription: A farmer is here visiting the big city.

NPC.name: bartender looking tired
NPC.description: A tired looking Bartender who hates trouble in his bar.
NPC.longDescription: A bartender watches you calmly, while he skillfully mixes a drink.

NPC.name: waiter looking tired
NPC.description: A tired looking waiter.
NPC.longDescription: A waiter is going around from one place to another.

NPC.name: waiter head confident
NPC.description: He is the best dressed waiter in the place and carries himself with an air of dignity.
NPC.longDescription: A man who in his young days was a famous sorcerer but now leads a quiet, peaceful life as a waiter.

NPC.name: waiter righteous
NPC.description: The waiter seems to be in communication with someone right now.
NPC.longDescription: A waiter who seems to have reached contact with God.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Cleric NoPurge Shopkeeper

NPC.name: waitress stoic
NPC.description: When she see sees you looking at her she stops staring at your money purse.
NPC.longDescription: A waitress without expression and knows where all her customers keep their money.

NPC.name: waiter perfect
NPC.description: He sees you looking at him and gestures for you to wait a minute.
NPC.longDescription: A waiter who's every move seems deliberate and purposeful is here working efficiently.

NPC.name: bartender man dirty smelly Filthy
NPC.description: This guy could use a bath. Nobody else seems to notice his 'problem' or if they do they aren't saying anything.
NPC.longDescription: A very dirty and smelly man is standing here. He seems to be the bartender and eager to serve you a special drink.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Thief NoPurge Shopkeeper

NPC.name: cavalier stern guard
NPC.description: A stern looking cavalier is standing here watching for trouble.
NPC.longDescription: A stern cavalier stands here watching for trouble.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger StayArea Warrior AssistAlign AssistGuard

NPC.name: entertainer
NPC.description: The entertainer looks at you and smiles.
NPC.longDescription: An entertainer is here attempting to entertain.

NPC.name: rogue dark
NPC.description: The rogue looks pretty mean.
NPC.longDescription: A dark rogue is here, looking for victims.

NPC.name: drunk
NPC.description: A drunk who seems to be too happy, and to carry too much money.
NPC.longDescription: A singing, happy drunk wanders around, singing about love.

NPC.name: beggar
NPC.description: The beggar looks like she is fed up with life.
NPC.longDescription: A beggar is here, asking for a few coins.

NPC.name: lighter lamp lamplighter
NPC.description: The lamp lighter is going about merrily lighting and extinguishing flames.
NPC.longDescription: A lamp lighter is busy here.

NPC.name: man hooded
NPC.description: A big man wearing a dark green cape.
NPC.longDescription: A hooded man is here watching and waiting.

NPC.name: priest soldier
NPC.description: A big, strong, helpful, trustworthy guard.
NPC.longDescription: A soldier priest is here, guarding the checkpoint.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Cleric Mage Warrior Rescue AssistAlign AssistPlayers AssistGuard

NPC.name: preacher
NPC.description: A crazy looking preacher.
NPC.longDescription: A preacher is here, preaching.

NPC.name: maid
NPC.description: The maid looks tired. She looks as though she is about to say something then changes her mind and continues with her work.
NPC.longDescription: A maid is here going about her business.

NPC.name: cavalier watching guard
NPC.description: Armored and well equipped the cavalier looks capable of handling any crisis situation.
NPC.longDescription: A cavalier is here watching for trouble.

NPC.name: cavalier guard sleepy asleep
NPC.description: The cavalier looks awfully tired.
NPC.longDescription: A cavalier is here guarding. The cavalier is half asleep.

NPC.name: sweeper street streetsweeper
NPC.description: The sweeper is very busy and never looks at you.
NPC.longDescription: A street sweeper is busily cleaning this area.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea Wimpy NoPurge Outdoors

NPC.name: bard
NPC.description: The bard smiles and nods at you while continuing to sing and play.
NPC.longDescription: A bard is here playing a lute and singing.
NPC.flags: NPC StayArea Mage Thief Warrior NoAlign Rescue

NPC.name: thug
NPC.description: He smiles evilly at you without blinking his eyes.
NPC.longDescription: A thug is here looking for trouble.

NPC.name: man fat citizen
NPC.description: He looks flushed and like he needs to rest.
NPC.longDescription: A fat citizen is here wandering the streets.

NPC.name: woman beautiful
NPC.description: She is gorgeous. Easily the most impressive woman in the room.
NPC.longDescription: A beautiful woman is gracing this area.

NPC.name: man handsome
NPC.description: He is quite a stud. He is probably the best looking man in the room.
NPC.longDescription: A handsome man is walking the street here.

NPC.name: woman fat
NPC.description: She looks tired from carrying all that extra baggage.
NPC.longDescription: A fat woman is here walking.

NPC.name: librarian
NPC.description: The librarian is busily organizing books by author and title.
NPC.longDescription: A librarian is here organizing books.

NPC.name: maid beautiful
NPC.description: She is very beautiful with golden hair, and deep blue eyes. A good reason for coming here more often.
NPC.longDescription: The maid is waiting for your order.

NPC.name: sexton
NPC.description: The sexton looks like he is relaxing after another grave-digging job.
NPC.longDescription: A sexton is sitting here, drinking hot tea.

NPC.name: attendant bath
NPC.description: The attendant is very discrete and doesn't look at you.
NPC.longDescription: A bath attendant is here with towels and soap.

NPC.name: man thin lanky
NPC.description: He looks like he lives off of the nuts that he sells.
NPC.longDescription: A thin, lanky man is here selling nuts.

NPC.name: guard jail
NPC.description: He looks very tough and like he really enjoy his job.
NPC.longDescription: A jail guard is here looking menacing.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior NoAlign AssistAlign AssistGuard AssistVnum

NPC.name: prisoner young
NPC.description: He leers at you then complains about how unfair the system is.
NPC.longDescription: A young prisoner is here angry at the system.

NPC.name: captain
NPC.description: He seems very angry about something. He stairs at you as though to say 'what now?!'
NPC.longDescription: The captain of the guard is looking very upset.

NPC.name: cavalier upset annoyed
NPC.description: The cavalier is annoyed about something and is scanning the surroundings.
NPC.longDescription: A cavalier stands here looking very upset.

NPC.name: secretary
NPC.description: She is under the desk and looks very busy. It looks like she really enjoys her work and pays great attention to detail.
NPC.longDescription: A secretary is under the desk. She is busy and can't talk right now.

NPC.name: manager bank
NPC.description: He is a stocky, middle-aged man with thin, grey hair. His breathing is rapid and he keeps sighing. He seems to be very happy about something.
NPC.longDescription: The bank manager is sitting here. He looks to be in a VERY good mood and is breathing funny.

NPC.name: crier
NPC.description: He is very good at his job - completely dissolved in tears.
NPC.longDescription: The town crier is here, weeping quietly.

NPC.name: waitress resa
NPC.description: Resa brushes a lock of dark hair out of her face and smiles warmly at you.
NPC.longDescription: The waitress hums to herself and wonders what you'd like to order.

NPC.name: prisoner scarred
NPC.description: He looks like he's been cut a few times.
NPC.longDescription: A prisoner covered with scars is telling stories of his exploits.

NPC.name: prisoner old
NPC.description: He is old and is in need of a shave. He talks really slow and has a slight stutter.
NPC.longDescription: An old prisoner who needs a shave is here.

NPC.name: prisoner angry female
NPC.description: She looks dirty and has the mouth to match.
NPC.longDescription: An angry female prisoner is here cursing the guards.

NPC.name: shifty thief
NPC.description: Well, COUNT your money!
NPC.longDescription: A shifty looking character is here.

NPC.name: monk warrior
NPC.description: His armor is shiny and clean, as are his weapons and manners. He probably is a tough opponent.
NPC.longDescription: The warrior monk stands here surveying the streets.
NPC.flags: NPC Aggressive StayArea Gain Warrior Rescue AssistAlign AssistGuard

NPC.name: apprentice
NPC.description: The apprentice looks bright eyed and full of wonder.
NPC.longDescription: An apprentice is here learning the business.

NPC.name: wanderer
NPC.description: The wanderer looks like he has been everywhere. Every step taken is sure and somehow conveys a warning.
NPC.longDescription: A wanderer is here walking about.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel Scavenger StayArea Warrior AssistAlign

NPC.name: citizen male
NPC.description: He is just standing here wearing loose fitting cotton clothes like most citizens wear.
NPC.longDescription: A male citizen of Calinth is here walking through town.

NPC.name: youth dirty
NPC.description: The youth is angry at society and at you!
NPC.longDescription: A dirty youth is here snarling at you.

NPC.name: traveler weary
NPC.description: The traveler looks very sleepy.
NPC.longDescription: The traveler looks tired from what has undoubtedly been a long day.

NPC.name: guest hotel
NPC.description: The guest looks back at you curiously.
NPC.longDescription: A hotel guest is here resting.

NPC.name: child
NPC.description: The child looks completely innocent of the harsh world around.
NPC.longDescription: A child is here playing.

NPC.name: man old
NPC.description: You can see the tales of a long life in the wrinkles of his face.
NPC.longDescription: An old man is standing here.

NPC.name: woman old
NPC.description: She looks like she has had a hard life.
NPC.longDescription: An old woman is here talking about something to nobody.

NPC.name: merchant traveling
NPC.description: The traveling merchant is very entertaining telling jokes and ribbing the customers as he cooly pockets their coins.
NPC.longDescription: A traveling merchant is here with all sorts of goods.

NPC.name: harlot
NPC.description: She winks at you and licks her lips.
NPC.longDescription: A harlot is selling her goods.
NPC.flags: NPC Scavenger StayArea Thief AssistAlign AssistVnum

NPC.name: ghost
NPC.description: The ghost is surprised that you can see it. It seems tormented and in pain.
NPC.longDescription: A ghost is haunting here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Undead Fade AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: Invisible DetectInvis DetectHidden ProtectionGood Sneak Hide Flying PassDoor DarkVision DetectIllusion

NPC.name: bodyguard
NPC.description: The bodyguard doesn't even blink. He looks really serious about his work.
NPC.longDescription: A bodyguard is doing his job here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior Rescue AssistGuard AssistVnum

NPC.name: man naked
NPC.description: He is bare naked and seems to like it. He has everything in the right place.
NPC.longDescription: A naked man is here enjoying himself.

NPC.name: woman naked
NPC.description: She is bare naked and likes it. She has everything in the right place.
NPC.longDescription: A naked woman is here enjoying herself.

NPC.name: master
NPC.description: The master's cloak keeps you from seeing if it is a man, a woman or neither.
NPC.longDescription: The master is here inspiring awe.

NPC.name: woman sultry

NPC.longDescription: A sultry, sexy woman is here selling drinks at the bar.

NPC.name: man short stocky
NPC.description: The man is very short and probably has been teased most of his life. He seems to be quite jovial and in a good mood.
NPC.longDescription: A short stocky man is here pouring drinks.

NPC.name: man busy clerk
NPC.description: He looks at you then continues counting and writing.

NPC.name: cavalier guard watching waiting

NPC.longDescription: A cavalier is standing here watching and waiting.
